clinical_study.brief_title: Volume Responsiveness Before SBT Predicts the Outcome of Mechanical Ventilation Weaning in Critically Ill Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Volume Responsiveness Before Spontaneous Breath Trial Predicts the Outcome of Mechanical Ventilation Weaning in Critically Ill Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the performance of volume responsiveness in predicting the outcome of mechanical ventilation weaning in critically ill patients.

arm_group.description: the SUCCESS of SBT or not need for reintubation or noninvasive ventilation within 48 h following extubation
the failure of SBT or the need for reintubation or noninvasive ventilation within 48 h following extubation

intervention.description: passive leg raising test was done before and at the end of SBT

study_pop.textblock: The patients were mechanically ventilated and ready to undergo a spontaneous breathing trial (SBT) with a T-piece

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- mechanical ventilation
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy or breast-feeding
- tracheostomy at baseline
- myasthenia gravis or acute polyradiculoneuropathy
- end-stage chronic illness
